Our Vision

Metaphor is a user interface kit (UI Kit) that ensures web applications maintain consistency with CSUN branding and identity standards. Metaphor was built specifically to improve the mobile user experience and assure compliance with ADA guidelines on all platforms. It will also extend the current utility of the Web-One guidelines to incorporate web-applications.

Take a look at our Metaphor Roadmap for upcoming components.


Getting Started

To include Metaphor in your next project simply run: bower install metaphor --save


Open Source

Metaphor gives you a comprehensive collection of HTML, CSS, and JS components which are simple to use, easy to customize and extendable.

For developers, Metaphor provides the flexibility to code in any programming language of choice and streamlines the process by providing reusable UI components. This allows developers to focus on functionality while ensuring their application adheres to compliance and branding guidelines.

Metaphor is a completely open source to encourage campus collaboration. Metaphor uses the MIT License. Interested in contributing or learning more? Check out Metaphor on Github.


Accessibility

Accessibility is extremely important when building applications for the CSUN community. The A11Y Project is a great community-driven resource to make web accessibility easier. The following are some great resources to checkout:

  • Web Accessibility Checklist
  • Learn How to Use Skip Navigation
  • Learn How to Use ARIA Labels

Paragraph Example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. In reiciendis consequuntur obcaecati suscipit nobis non voluptatem, ipsam dicta recusandae eligendi enim impedit et sapiente ipsum cupiditate incidunt ex? Dicta, dolor. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Saepe, eligendi, dolores! Beatae ab obcaecati sed consequatur, reiciendis, odio culpa deserunt repudiandae! Rem ipsam non mollitia quod! Nemo, esse! Quisquam.


<h1>Headline Example 1</h1>
<h2>Headline Example 2</h2>
<h3>Headline Example 3</h3>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.</p>

Alerts

Pro Tip: Try Hitting Refresh! ×
Pro Tip: Try Hitting Refresh! ×
Success! Data Saved. ×
Warning! Data Storage Limited. ×
Danger! Something went horribly wrong. Application will self destruct in 1min... × 

<div class="alert alert--default">
  <strong>Pro Tip:</strong> Try Hitting Refresh!
  <a href="#" class="alert__close" data-alert-close>×</a>
</div>
<div class="alert alert--info">
  <strong>Pro Tip:</strong> Try Hitting Refresh!
  <a href="#" class="alert__close" data-alert-close>×</a>
</div>
<div class="alert alert--success">
  <strong>Success!</strong> Data Saved.
  <a href="#" class="alert__close" data-alert-close>×</a>
</div>
<div class="alert alert--warning">
  <strong>Warning!</strong> Data Storage Limited.
  <a href="#" class="alert__close" data-alert-close>×</a>
</div>
<div class="alert alert--danger">
  <strong>Danger!</strong> Something went horribly wrong. Application will self destruct in 1min...
  <a href="#" class="alert__close" data-alert-close>×</a>
</div>

  <tr>
    <th>Deal One</th>
    <th>Deal Two</th>
    <th>Deal Three</th>
  </tr>

<tbody>
  <tr>
    <td>Col 1</td>
    <td>Col 2</td>
    <td>Col 3</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table>

Forms


<form>
  <div class="form__group">
    <label class="label--required" for="example0">Full Name</label>
    <input id="example1" name="example0" type="text" placeholder="Full Name">
  </div>
  <div class="form__group">
    <label class="label--required" for="example1">Type</label>
    <select name="example1" id="example1">
      <option value="">-- Select Type --</option>
      <option value="">Jedi</option>
      <option value="">Wookie</option>
      <option value="">Sith</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  <div class="form__group">
    <label class="label--required" for="example2">Comments</label>
    <textarea id="example2" name="example2" placeholder="Comments..." rows="4"></textarea>
  </div>
</form>

Modals

Working with modals is super simple. Create your modal markup and then trigger the event with a button.

Modal Title
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Alias dolore, aliquam nesciunt praesentium nemo amet laudantium voluptatem, libero consectetur doloribus blanditiis sint asperiores provident sequi minus atque, vitae minima tenetur!

Login

<button class="btn btn-default" data-modal="#test">Modal Powers Activate!!!</button>

<div id="test" class="modal__outer">
  <div class="modal">
    <div class="modal__header">
      <strong>Modal Title</strong>
    </div>
    <div class="modal__content">Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Alias dolore, aliquam nesciunt praesentium nemo amet laudantium voluptatem, libero consectetur doloribus blanditiis sint asperiores provident sequi minus atque, vitae minima tenetur!</div>
    <div class="modal__footer">
      <div class="pull-right">
        <button class="btn btn-default" data-modal-close="#test">Cancel</button>
        <button class="btn btn-primary">Submit</button>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="modal__close" data-modal-close="#test"><i class="fa fa-times" aria-hidden="true"></i></div>
  </div>
</div>
